intro: Gethyllis unilateralis, commonly known as the single-sided grassblow, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland fynbos vegetation. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, and it is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
